parameters.n: numeric, number of 19 and 19 year olds registered
parameters.treatedIndex: numeric, a counter indexing the 42 treated units
parameters.treated: numeric, 1 if a treated cable system, 0 otherwise
parameters.r: numeric, number of 18 and 19 year olds turning out
parameters.p: numeric, proportion of 18 and 19 year olds turning out

reference:
Green and Vavreck (2008) implemented a cluster-randomized
experimental design in assessing the effects of a voter mobilization
treatment in the 2004 U.S. Presidential election.  The clusters in this
design are geographic areas served by a single cable television system.
So as to facilitate analysis, the researchers restricted their
attention to small cable systems whose reach is limited to a single zip
code.  Further, since the experiment was fielded during the last week
of the presidential election, the researchers restricted their search
to cable systems that were not in the 16 hotly-contested
“battleground” states (as designated by the Los Angeles
Times).
title: Voter turnout experiment, using Rock The Vote ads
description:
Description
Voter turnout data spanning 85 cable TV systems, randomly allocated to
a voter mobilization experiment targeting 18-19 year olds with "Rock
the Vote" television advertisements
format: A data frame with 85 observations on the following 6 variables.
